info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 26 at 7:24PM MST until September 26 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa.
* WHEN...Until 1030 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Phoenix, Scottsdale, Paradise Valley, Scottsdale Airport, Camelback Mountain, Downtown Scottsdale, Piestewa Peak Park and Salt River Indian Community. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MST THIS EVENING
